original_prompt: In this task, you will be presented with a context from an academic paper and a question based on the context. You have to classify the questions into "Extractive", "Abstractive", or "Yes-no" questions. Extractive questions can be answered by concatenating extracts taken from a context into a summary while answering abstractive questions involves paraphrasing the context using novel sentences. Yes-no question is a question whose expected answer is one of two choices, one that affirms the question and one that denies the question. Typically, the choices are either yes or no.
generated_prompts: You will be given a context from an academic paper and a question based on it. Your task is to classify the questions into "Extractive", "Abstractive", or "Yes-no". Extractive questions can be answered by combining excerpts from the context into a summary. Abstractive questions require you to paraphrase the context using unique sentences. Yes-no questions have two possible answers, either 'yes' or 'no'.

In this task, you will be given a context from an academic paper and a question based on it. You need to classify the question into one of three categories: "Extractive", "Abstractive", or "Yes-no". Extractive questions require you to combine extracts from the context into a summary to answer them, while abstractive questions require you to paraphrase the context with new sentences. Yes-no questions require a response of either yes or no to affirm or deny the question.

Given a context from an academic paper and a question based on the context, your task is to classify the questions into "Extractive", "Abstractive", or "Yes-no" questions.
